text: I wonder where that bird from earlier came from?
I heard a giant condor settled in an old mako reactor on a remote island.
I’ve heard that story before. But there’s no way to get to that island.
An island, huh...Guess there’s nothing we can do about it.
Yeah, let’s head to Junon first.
No, there’s a small village beneath the fortress city.
Under Junon. A rundown fishing village.
Shinra’s mess always trickles down. Same story everywhere.
If you want a break, head to Under Junon.
To get to Under Junon, follow the coast.
Welcome to Under Junon, a village that never sees the sun.
I’m Rhodna. Village chief and head of security.
Guess I’ll report you. If I’m right, that’s 100,000 gil.
Sorry, but you’d better give it up.
You’re Aerith, right? You’re worth 500,000 gil.
But you know, I’m real good at looking the other way.
This ain’t a trap, is it?
Learn this village’s history, and you’ll see it’s not.
If you don’t like it, get out.
It’s dead quiet there. Make yourselves at home.
Haven’t seen any guys in black cloaks around?
Some folks in black suits came through, though. Two guys and a woman.
They went up on that elevator.
You probably know this, but up there’s Junon, Shinra’s fortress city.
That elevator’s for Shinra personnel only.
Something’s going on up there, and security’s tight. The Soldiers are on edge.
If you pull something and drag this village into it, I won’t forgive you.
I won’t report you, so relax.
So, what’s the plan? Looks like the black cloaks didn’t come here.
if they’re leaving this region, as far as I know, it’s either by sea or by air.
Let’s split up and gather info.
Whether we can get a ship here, or find other routes.
I’m also curious about where those black cloaks went.
Meet back at the inn when we’re done?
Long ago, the capital of the Junon Republic used to be out in these waters.
They say it was a floating city, made of massive ships linked together.
That glorious floating city fell to Shinra’s attack and sank to the ocean floor.
And on the land overlooking that sea, Shinra built an unsinking city of steel.
Almost like a tombstone for the Republic...I’ve heard that tale before.
This is a fishing village, so naturally, they’ve got boats.
But word came down from above banning fishing. No end date given.
With the condition we don’t drag the villagers into it, borrowing a boat’s gonna be tough.
Back in the day, they say you could head offshore and reel in big ones left and right.
But ever since they built that mako reactor on the seabed, monsters started popping up, and it’s been a bust.
Damn Shinra, they’ve trashed the sea too!
They’re holding a big Shinra event in the city up top.
The folks here are upset about never seeing the sun.
So if we start feeling comfy here, I kinda feel bad about it.
Looks like the only way to the upper city is that elevator.
It’s heavily guarded. Better not get too close.
Sir, with that sword on your back, I’m begging you.
That voice belongs to Priscilla, a kid from the village. Please go help her out!
Hurry, this way! There’s a boat drifting out there!
I don’t taste good, I swear~!
Blow that monster away, like you did that mako reactor!
We need to secure her airway first.
Shouldn’t we call a doctor from up top?
Her body temp’s dropping. We gotta hurry.
They split from Avalanche over some disagreement and went their own way.
These folks are my guests. They’re the ones who saved you.
Sorry~! You saved me, and here I am being a total dummy!
Alright, Yuffie, go rest in a room for now.
Hate to say it, but kids these days, huh.
Another guest. More show up when the world gets messy.
Monsters like that keep multiplying every year. All thanks to those mako reactors.
You saved us. Thanks, on behalf of the village.
Thanks, big brothers! That was so cool~!
I’m Priscilla. Nice to meet you!
You guys are from Avalanche’s splinter group, right?
How the hell do you know—
I totally look up to you guys! Way, way more than the main group!
Hey, can we meet up later? I’ve got a favor to ask!
Gotta thank you too, right? Right!
There’s always someone pulling the respect scam.
She’s just a kid, though. I’ll brush her off easy.
Heard you folks were heroes out at sea!
Rhodna told me to treat you right.
Oh, no charge! It’s our thanks for saving Priscilla.
Well then, guess we’ll rest up tonight.
The rooms are small, but make yourselves at home.
It’s been a while since we’ve had this many rooms filled.
That girl we saved, Yuffie, said she’s got a favor to ask.
What do you think Yuffie’s favor is?
She’s planning to report us to Shinra.
Good thing I practiced my signature for moments like this!
Want me to sign somethin’ for you too?
Maybe she wants to join Avalanche.
I’d love to say we don’t turn anyone away,
but we ain’t got time to babysit a kid right now.
Guess we’ll just have to brush her off.
Could be she’s planning to snitch to Shinra.
A real respect scam, huh? Might need to give her a lecture.
Didn’t think wanted posters would spread this far.
I’ll let you know if anything comes up, so you rest up.
I wanted to stop it, to say no, but there was nothing I could do.
Yeah, that’s how it felt. It was taken by force.
But I don’t know what’s missing. It’s all foggy~...
We haven’t seen them since then.
You must be tired. Get some rest.
It hasn’t been that long since we left Midgar, but it feels like we’ve come so far.
I wonder how Mom and Marlene are doing?
Hey, do you remember the first time we met?
Do you remember the first time we met?
You forced a flower on me.
You forced a flower on me.
I gave it as a present.
That flower—you put it up in Seventh Heaven, right? I think it was Tifa who decorated with it, though.
Giving something a girl gave you to another girl? I’m not sure how I feel about that~
Keep it in mind for next time.
Bzzzt! That was the second time.
Walking on the rooftops together...That was fun, wasn’t it?
No way~! Come on, I gave you that flower, didn’t I?
I wonder where those guys in black cloaks went.
What’s that event upstairs all about?
Perfect timing. I was just about to head to my room.
I wanted to apologize about Kalm.
No, it’s fine. We both had our moments, right?
Hey, do you remember Emilio...? The one from Nibelheim?
Do you remember Emilio from Nibelheim?
I don’t remember anyone but Tifa.
The general store owner’s son, right?
I don’t remember anyone but Tifa.
Come on, the one whose family ran the general store.
Oh...Well, the general store owner’s son—
Emilio left the village a little before you did, Cloud.
I hadn’t seen him since then, but he showed up at Seventh Heaven last year.
He said he doesn’t come to the slums much. He seemed a little different, maybe.
So anyway, he was with this girl, and she was absolutely gorgeous...
Not really. But I’ll listen if you wanna talk.
I guess it kinda turned out that way. Sorry.
Let’s talk properly next time. Clear the air.
Next time, we’ll spill our guts.
If it’s a contest, my abs won’t lose.
You should rest in your room too, Cloud.
The smell of the sea is too strong in this town.
It drowns out other scents. I might not notice if Shinra shows up.
I might not notice Shinra’s scent.
Even if my nose fails, my ears still work. I’ll let you know if I hear anything suspicious.
My nose is all itchy. It’s uncomfortable.
I wasn’t counting on it from the start.
Hmph. Then I’ll just take a nap.
Would you like to rest in bed?
I’m an elite materia hunter of Wutai’s provisional government special forces, Yuffie~!
I came all the way from afar to fight the wicked, tyrannical Shinra Company.
Descendant of the ninja, that’s me!
So, here’s the deal—I’ve got a proposition.
How about teaming up with me?
I figured if I’m gonna team up, I’d rather go with the splinter group than the main branch.
Ninja work’s all about spying or assassination, right?
But this time, I might’ve hit the jackpot.
Poor little Yuffie-chan, far from her homeland of Wutai,
has been bravely funding her anti-Shinra efforts all on her own while she keeps up the fight.
So I was sniffing around here for some cash, and then the village head, Rhodna—
says she’s got an assassination job for me!
None other than the bold new president of Shinra Company—
Word is, Rufus is coming to Junon soon.
Seems he’s casually throwing some inauguration parade or something.
The folks here have hated Shinra ever since they stole their country and their sun.
The village head’s so desperate for that reward money, she’s planning to sell you guys out to Shinra.
Too bad—it looks like you’re already sold.
You’re in there, aren’t you, my frieeend~!
I’ll ask Priscilla to figure out a way upstairs,
you guys take care of the rest!
Come out quick, or I’ll barge in with my bike! You good with that, my friend~?
Indoors puts us at a disadvantage. Let’s head outside.
Still not coming? Hurry up and show your face!
You’re really keeping me waiting, huh?
I can’t wait any longer, my frieeend~!
Ahha~! Still as cold as ever.
Good news for a friend like you—
I’ve been handpicked for the Aerith Rescue Task Force!
Came by to let you know.
Hahahah! This time’s just a friendly hello.
This place isn’t quite right for us to dance.
A bit too dull, don’t you think?
Neither of us wants an unsatisfying fight, right?
I’ve got the perfect stage set up topside.
I’ll be waiting for you there, my frieeend~!
Sounds like a real pain in the ass.
We should get outta here, right? It’ll cause trouble for the village too.
Yuffie said to rely on Priscilla if we’re heading up, didn’t she?
You sold us out, you bastard! That’s some nerve!
Here, it ain’t much, but take it.
It’s the bounty that was on your heads.
I was planning to give you some of it anyway.
No point in anti-Shinra folks fighting each other, right?
And if we’d really gotten caught, then what?!
We’d deal with it then. It worked out, so what’s the problem?
Now we just pray Yuffie pulls it off.
Here’s the thing—all the materia we had went missing.
We couldn’t use it well anyway, so it’s not a huge loss, but...
I hate to suspect her, but could it be Yuffie?
Hm? Priscilla? She was down by the coast.
We need to go up. Yuffie said to rely on you.
and she says the easiest way to get to Junon is by using that ship over there.
See, you can control the ship from over there.
Someone goes to the control room and lowers the ship.
The rest board it and get pulled up, huh?
The issue is how to get to the control room.
Yeah, they run electricity through it so intruders can’t climb up.
That’s where Mr. Dolphin comes in!
Mr. Dolphin’s amazing! Um, let’s see...
Oh, right! Wanna hear about how I met Mr. Dolphin?
So, I was swimming in the sea, and I heard this "kwee-kwee" sound—
We’ll come back after we’re done, so you can tell us about Mr. Dolphin then, okay?
It’s like this, this, and this!
You jump with Mr. Dolphin’s help!
So, who’s gonna get launched by Mr. Dolphin?
Alright, just let me know when you’re ready!
Ready to head up? (You won’t be able to return to Under Junon for a while.)
and Mr. Dolphin will tow you to the ship!
This thing ain’t gonna sink, right?
Big bro, big sis, doggy person—be careful out there~!
Maybe they’re busy with parade prep?
Guess they ain’t got time to mess with us, huh?
That works out nicely for us.
It’s a big place, though. Finding those black cloaks won’t be easy.
They don’t seem to be here. Let’s check the town.
Shinra’s latest high-speed airship, built to show off their prestige.
How about we ditch the boat and snag that instead?
Only a handful of pilots can handle an airship.
Let’s head into town and find a ship.
No, leave it as is. Let them swim.
Someone claiming to be an envoy of Wutai’s Governor Sufur requests an audience.
Can we assume you’re taking over the vision our Governor and the former President had in mind?
The theme of the next era will be the struggle over Huge Materia.
Shinra and Wutai clashing across the globe to keep the tension alive.
But with the President dead, the situation’s changed.
Still love your little drawings, huh, young master...
You still believe in fairy tales like the Promised Land?
The Shinra family only cares about sucking up mako.
You’ve gotta give something back, or the planet’s done for.
The anger, sorrow, and hatred war brings forge unmatched unity and exhilaration.
It rouses the world, and that spirit nourishes the planet.
For the planet’s future, let’s take it right to the edge of ruin.
You’re the ones who started it, aren’t you?
You’re not a kid anymore. We can’t have you bailing whenever you feel like it.
Almost forgot—a message from Governor Sufur.
Congratulations on your presidency. Wishing you continued success.
Cloud, you know Junon pretty well?
It’s a military city with a mako reactor under the sea.
In emergencies, the whole city turns into a fortress to fend off enemies from the ocean.
It’s a key hub for air and sea routes, second only to Midgar for Shinra.
Wow~! What about good food or tourist spots?
Aerith, you ain’t plannin’ to go sightseein’, are ya?
Listen up—the President’s Award belongs to us, the Midgar Seventh Infantry Regiment!
We’ll show those Junon punks Midgar’s refined formations!
Rest up until the parade starts!
Are those guys gonna be in the parade?
Tryin’ to impress the new prez, huh?
Didn’t wanna say it ‘cause it’s a big deal, but I can’t hold it in.
Rufus is close by, and you don’t think it’s lame to just walk on past?
Not sayin’ we kill him, but a word or two—maybe a punch or three—sounds good, right?
Kinda agree with part of that.
The Turks said they’re not chasing us anymore,
but that bike guy said something about ‘protection.’ They need to make up their minds!
But can we really get to the president?
We’re crashin’ the parade, ain’t we?!
No, most of the participants are Soldiers. Too many to take on as enemies.
We’ll get close to Rufus as part of the parade.
That way, we avoid trouble ‘til the last second.
Barret, Red—check the route to the port and scope out the security.
And of course, keep an eye out for the black cloaks.
Alright, I’m off. First up—grabbing those uniforms.
Anyone not in uniform yet, there are spares pressed and ready in this room.
Uniforms are in the room—get changed quick!
You haven’t changed yet? Hurry, or it’ll start without you!
Cloud, sir~! What’re you up to~?
Cloud, you’re a little too close...
No—gestures and speech matter too. Follow my lead from here.
The parade venue is Upper Junon.
Head there early so you don’t miss the start!
You lot weren’t at the rehearsal! Don’t tell me you’re late!
Do you even grasp how critical this parade is?!
Get inside now! The commander’ll check your moves.
I’ll feed you to a behemoth!
I’ve got the standard drills memorized. Just copy me.
What’re you muttering about? Get in there!
Showing up late to rehearsal takes guts. You must be real confident, huh?
Mess up even once, and I’ll toss you into a malboro’s maw!
Those precise, sharp moves—that unshakable core!
How about letting them lead the parade?
As of now, I’m appointing you captain of the Midgar Seventh Infantry Regiment!
You’ll lead the parade—a key role as an example to all.
Whether we win the President’s Award rests entirely on you. Remember that.
Good. First, gather our troops in Upper Junon.
They’re split into squads around town. Round up at least five of ‘em!
They’re all wearing Midgar Seventh Infantry armbands.
Once they’re assembled, bring ‘em to Upper Junon for the parade.
No tardiness allowed—take this mission seriously.
We’re counting on you, got it~?
Some might be drinking to loosen up—check the bars and taverns.
If you’re sightseeing, Junon’s symbol is a must-see.
The nervous ones might be staring at the sea.
With little free time, some might be shopping.
Heard there’s a panel of President Rufus somewhere. Why not take a look?
Hey, can we really get close to Rufus during the march?
Not quite. We’re aiming for the President’s Award.
We’re gathering the troops in town, right?
The ones with these armbands, huh?
The parade’s being broadcast to Midgar too, huh?
Hope our full-on march cheers up the folks who got hit hard.
I’ll lead you to the parade venue. Everyone, fall in behind me!
If you’re drinking here, lose the helmet first.
Captain, this bar’s a bit special—helmets don’t fly here.
Wanna drink with us? Ditch the helmet and prove it.
Only those who bare it all can drink here.
That getup—you’re in the parade, right? Good luck out there.
After this deployment, I’m getting transferred to an Avalanche search unit.
For real. Don’t know where yet, though.
Oh...well, let’s make some memories together!
Hey, we’re in the middle of something important here!
Ugh, I dragged my senior down—and the supervisor might’ve seen it...
So this is Junon’s famous cannon? Bigger than I imagined.
But thanks to the Wutai treaty, it hasn’t fired in years, right?
Nice—a giant weapon banned from use. That’s romantic~!
I’ll lead you to the parade venue. Everyone, fall in!
Hey, where’s the new president been all this time?
Traveling around, away from Midgar, I think?
So he knows the field well, huh?
But that means he doesn’t know Midgar’s troops, right?
Let’s show him what we’ve got!
So, tell us your enthusiasm for the parade!
We, the Midgar Seventh Infantry Regiment, have undergone rigorous training for this very day.
With our finest performance, we wish to celebrate the inauguration of our new president, Rufus.
Lastly, could you share a word for the people of Midgar?
We’ll march forward carrying everyone’s hopes on our shoulders.
What’s that? I’m in the middle of an interview here!
Could I trouble you for a quick interview?
This parade promises to be a fierce competition. Any secret strategies you’d care to share?
If he spilled the secret strategy, it wouldn’t be a secret anymore, right?
Break’s over. Head to the parade grounds. Follow me.
Yes! Are you here today to watch the parade?
No, just passing through on business, but I’ll catch the parade while I’m at it.
It’s a big event for our company, after all.
Today’s also the inauguration of our new president, Rufus.
What’s your impression of the new president?
Young as he is, he’s got leadership, grace, and dignity to spare.
Above all, he’s got that Shinra spirit.
From now on, we employees will stand united to support the new president wholeheartedly.
Uh, wait—is this airing in Midgar too?
Then can I say something to my daughter?
Hey there! Watching this? It’s your dad!
Right now, Dad’s in Junon on a business trip!
Oh, and I saw the Mako Cannon!
It’s way bigger than I imagined—like, several times over!
I really wanted to see it with the whole family, though.
Next time, let’s come here on a family trip—not for work. Promise!
I’ll bring back tons of souvenirs, so listen to your mom and study hard, okay?
And go easy on Fort Condor, alright?
As expected of the fortress city Junon! They’ve got some serious combat-ready gear here.
Hell yeah, it’s obvious! The Mako Cannon master model!
Exactly! It’s a limited kit you can only get here!
Building this thing’s been my dream!
What, you want the limited kit too?
Move a bit more toward the center, everyone.
Come on, strike a proper pose!
Captain, perfect timing! Could you take the camera?
Captain, you nailed it! I’m framing this at home!
Break’s over. Head to the parade grounds. Follow me.
You’re giving her a brooch with two crossed machine guns? Are you serious?
Maybe the one with crossed bayonets would be better?
I’m starting to feel sorry for her.
I’m picking a gift for my girlfriend,
Machine gun brooch or bayonet brooch—which do you think?
Don’t ask him something so ridiculous. Sorry, Captain, ignore him.
Our heavy infantry’s "Ifrit Form" is hands-down the best, no question.
Nah, the grenadiers’ "Ramuh Form" is pretty tough to beat.
For stability, it’s gotta be the riot squad’s "Shiva Form."
Hmph...If we could come up with a formation that gives every unit a moment to shine, the president’s award would be ours for sure.
Captain, may I ask you something?
What’s your plan for today’s parade formation?
I’ll decide based on conditions and the situation.
No need to worry. Just follow my lead.
The captain’s back from the hotel!
Thanks for booking the celebration venue!
we’ll march with the whole world watching.
The expectations of Midgar’s citizens rest on our shoulders.
The captain will lead us from the front. All we need to do is trust him and follow.
We came here to win. And we’re taking the president’s award too.
That’s the only goal for this parade.
Captain, it’s about time for the venue.
What? I’m just a sailor! Ain’t nothin’ suspicious here!
Oh, it’s you guys! Don’t scare me like that!
Don’t laugh at my last resort!
Checked the route to the docks. You guys...
Looks like you’re handlin’ it fine.
Yeah, blending in better than expected.
We’re aiming for the president’s award!
Security to the docks is decent, but with all these people...
Blend in with Shinra, and we’ll manage.
Still, it’s a ballsy plan. I like it! I’ll root for your parade!
I can tell by the scent.
Since leaving the mako city, my natural abilities seem to be returning.
I’d like to leave this place soon too.
The kids are targeting me. They’re itching to pet me.
For one clad in fur...being underestimated is the end.
We need to gather the troops.
Midgar Seventh Infantry Regiment, reporting in!
Looks like you made it in time this round.
The parade starts soon. No regrets, I assume?
Will you participate in the parade?
The unit should already be assembled.
When’s the last time you fired it?
Young master, this cannon’s firing drills are on hold. It’s one of the ceasefire terms with Wutai.
Show them the times have changed.
Nothing gets the blood pumping like a good firefight!
I’m here live in Upper Junon!
Take a look—such a crowd, such energy!
Everyone’s eagerly awaiting the arrival of our new president, Rufus!
Next up, the bike squad takes the stage!
And here comes our new president, Rufus!
Can you hear it? This roar of cheers!
Now, the dawn of a new era.
Junon’s iconic Mako Cannon has just been fired!
The parade in Upper Junon is down to its final unit.
Here come Midgar’s elite—the Seventh Infantry Regiment!
they’ll bring back the president’s award to boost Midgar’s recovery.
What kind of performance will they deliver?
All eyes on the Midgar Seventh Infantry Regiment!
The Midgar Seventh Infantry Regiment has completed their first performance.
Votes from our viewers are being tallied as we speak.
Is the captain’s orders not getting through?
The team’s movements were all over the place. They’ll need to pull it together for the next one.
A decent start, I’d say. You can feel their potential shining through.
Let’s hope they keep pushing forward!
The crowd’s roaring for their spirited performance!
Can’t wait to see what’s next!
The Midgar Seventh Infantry Regiment has wrapped up their second performance.
Votes from our viewers are being tallied right now.
Their training’s not paying off here. No sharpness in their movements at all.
Here’s hoping for a comeback in the finale!
They pulled through without a hitch! The captain’s orders were fired up too.
At this rate, the finale could be explosive!
Outstanding! A perfectly synchronized, stunning display!
They’re set to close out this parade with pure brilliance!
All parade performances have just concluded!
Viewer votes are being tabulated as we speak.
Honestly, the Seventh Infantry Regiment’s routine was a letdown.
A real buzzkill of a finale. But the final judging’s still up in the air.
The Seventh Infantry Regiment closed it out with a solid, steady showing.
Can’t wait to see how President Rufus rates this reliable performance!
Thunderous applause and cheers for the Seventh Infantry Regiment!
Their performance will go down in Shinra history!
Which unit will claim the president’s award? The award ceremony’s coming right up!
The captain’s orders aren’t getting through.
I bet they can push harder!
You can feel the unit’s bond!
Can’t take my eyes off this!
This could be a legendary performance!
Yes, all clear. They haven’t noticed our surveillance.
Talk to them. You track the black cloaks.
Break’s over. Resume pursuit of the black cloaks.
Well done on President Rufus’s inauguration parade!
Witnessing your passion and loyalty, the new president is absolutely delighted!
Now, let’s proceed with the award ceremony!
First, from the overall category, the Outstanding Performance Award!
The Outstanding Performance Award goes to—
The Outstanding Performance Award goes to the Midgar Seventh Infantry Regiment!
The troops are hugging each other, shouting with joy!
The commander shares a firm handshake with the captain and heads to the stage!
Director Heidegger has presented a shield to the Midgar Seventh Infantry Regiment!
Even the usually stern commander is smiling, waving back at the cheering crowd!
Applause of praise echoes endlessly through the streets of Junon!
The Outstanding Performance Award has been won by the Highway Bike Patrol!
Captain Roche, the SOLDIER leading the unit, revs his engine in triumph!
Is Captain Roche truly one with his bike?
No other unit can argue with this love for bikes!
Applause honoring the Highway Bike Patrol resounds through Junon!
Next, we’ll announce the president’s award!
took Shinra, once just a weapons development firm, and built it into the world’s greatest company,
bringing everyone the wealth known as mako.
First, I’d like to express my gratitude to that great man.
some may feel uneasy that a young upstart like me has become the new president.
We now face many challenges. The world must change.
We must shed our old shell and move forward with courage.
I’ll show the way. Follow me without fear.
Until everyone reaches the promised land,
I swear here to fulfill my duty with honor and unwavering resolve.
So, my friends, let’s build a new world together!
Now, I’ll announce the president’s award.
The Seventh Infantry Regiment from Midgar has brilliantly claimed the president’s award!
Amid swirling confetti, the crowd and other units unite to celebrate the dawn of a new world!
The troops just called out by President Rufus are now ascending the stage!
In recognition of your powerful performance, I hereby present the president’s award to the Midgar Seventh Infantry Regiment.
President Rufus offers words of praise to the troops!
The troops must be overwhelmed with emotion—
I’d like to speak with them directly. Cut the broadcast.
It’s your big moment. Why not take off the helmet?
Cloud Strife, I had you looked into.
Quite an interesting history. I like it.
how about a deal with me?
I need to focus on Midgar’s reconstruction.
If the citizens’ lives don’t return to normal, Shinra will lose a lot of trust.
To focus on that effort, I want to offload some tedious chores.
The negative legacy from my old man’s era—recovering the Ancient stolen from headquarters,
and the arrest and punishment of Avalanche.
All of that’s just busywork to me. I’d rather be free of it.
You’re saying you won’t chase us anymore...?
Though I can’t control public sentiment. Stay away from Midgar for a while.
So I’m not needed anymore either?
You said it’s a deal. What’s the condition?
A monster born of old Shinra, a relic of the past.
I’d like to dispose of him, but internal coordination’s a hassle.
They’re Sephiroth’s—let’s call them avatars. Follow them, and you’ll reach the real thing.
Looks like we can climb from here!
Dammit...Where’d that ninja girl run off to?
Don’t panic. Let’s look for her.
Hey, now’s a real bad time!
You’ll tell the whole company? Professor Hojo and the Turks too?
Don’t underestimate me, you stray dogs.
That was Yuffie just now, right?
